JSN
is Jason Schmidt â€“ a digital product designer in Silicon Valley.

Jason founded Visualplant — an innovative platform for companies to encode, distribute and curate video.

Before that he was the Director of Product Design for Advertising Age — regarded as "the bible of advertising."

Back in the day he helped Napster — the revolutionary music sharing service — appease the courts and design their next-generation product.

In between and along the way he has designed more than a dozen Web and mobile apps for clients such as Sony Music, Sabre Travel Network and a heaping handful of startups.

Jason is a design partner; he's willing to persevere through many iterations to realize a company vision and design products that market themselves. His focus is user experience cultivated through communication design and simple, smart technology.

See work portfolio   →
 
Currently, Jason is doing Web design for Stanford University.

If you'd like to get in touch, email JSN. You should also follow JSN on Twitter.
